definition.name: NXbeam_splitter

symbol.name: N_spectrum
symbol.doc: Length of the spectrum vector (e.g. wavelength or energy) for which the refractive index of the beam splitter material and/or coating is defined.

symbol.name: N_spectrum_RT
symbol.doc: Length of the spectrum vector (e.g. wavelength or energy) for which the reflectance or transmission of the beam splitter is given.

symbol.name: N_shapepar
symbol.doc: Number of parameters needed do descripe the shape of the beam splitter.

symbol.name: N_objects
symbol.doc: Number of objects the beam splitter is made up of.

symbol.name: N_outputs
symbol.doc: Number of outputs, i.e. number of paths the beam takes after being split by the beam splitter.

definition.doc:
A beam splitter, i.e. a device splitting the light into two or more beams.
Information about types and properties of beam splitters is provided e.g. [here](https://www.rp-photonics.com/beam_splitters.html).
Use two or more NXbeam_paths to describe the beam paths after the beam splitter. In the dependency chain of the new beam paths, the first elements each point to this beam splitter, as this is the previous element.

field.name: type
field.doc: Specify the beam splitter type (e.g. dielectric mirror, pellicle, dichroic mirror etc.). Shape (e.g. prism, plate, cube) and dimension should be described in 'geometry'. Define if the beam splitter is polarizing or not in the field 'polarizing(NX_BOOLEAN)'.

field.name: other_type
field.doc: If you selected 'other' in 'type' use this field to specify which type of beam splitter was used.

field.name: polarizing
field.doc: Is the beam splitter polarizing?

field.name: multiple_outputs
field.doc: Does the beam splitter have multiple outputs (diffractive optical element), i.e. more than two outputs?

group.doc: Describe the geometry (shape, dimension etc.) of the beam splitter. Specify the dimensions in 'SHAPE/size'. A sketch of the device should be provided in the 'sketch(NXdata)' field to clarify (i) the shape and dimensions of the device, and (ii) the input and outputs (i.e. the direction of the incoming and outcoming (split) beams).

field.name: shape
field.doc: Describe the shape (plate, cube, wedged, prism etc.).

field.name: other_shape
field.doc: If you chose 'other' in 'shape' describe what it is.

group.name: sketch
group.doc: Sketch of the beam splitter showing its geometry. The paths of the incoming and split beam should be illustrated and labelled (0 for the incoming beam, and 1, 2,..., N_outputs for the outputs (i.e. the split beam paths)).

field.name: size
field.doc:
Physical extent of the beam splitter device. The beam splitter might be made up of one or more objects (NX_objects). The meaning and location of the axes used will vary according to the value of the 'shape' variable. 'N_shapepar' defines how many parameters:
* For 'cube' the parameters are (width, length). * For 'cylinder' the parameters are (diameter, length). * For 'plate' the parameters are (width, height, length). * For 'prism' the parameters are (width, height, length). * For 'wedged' the parameters are (width, height, shortest length). The wedge angle should be provided in 'SHAPE/wedge_angle'. * For 'other' the parameters may be (A, B, C, ...) with the labels defined in the sketch plotted in 'SHAPE/sketch'.

field.name: wedge_angle
field.doc: Wedge angle if 'shape' is 'wedged'.

field.name: splitting_ratio
field.doc: Beam splitting ratio(s) for the various outputs (i.e. the paths of the beam after being split by the beam splitter). The order of the ratios must be consistent with the labels 1, 2, ... N_outputs defined by the sketch in 'SHAPE/sketch', starting with 1.

field.name: clear_aperture
field.doc: Clear aperture of the device (e.g. 90% of diameter for a disc, or 90% of length and height for square geometry).

group.name: substrate
group.doc: Substrate of the beam splitter. Describe the material of the substrate in substrate/substrate_material and provide its index of refraction in substrate/index_of_refraction_substrate, if known.

field.name: substrate_material
field.doc: Specify the material of the beam splitter. If the device has a coating it should be described in coating/coating_material. Is the material birefringent?

field.name: substrate_thickness
field.doc: Thickness of the beam splitter substrate. Define the minimum and maximum thickness (for a wedged geomtry). For a homogeneous thickness (e.g. as in plate beam splitters) the minimum and maximum values are equal.

field.name: index_of_refration_substrate
field.doc: Complex index of refraction of the beam splitter substrate. Specify at given spectral values (e.g. wavelength, energy, wavenumber etc.).

group.name: coating
group.doc: Is the beam splitter coated? If yes, specify the type and material of the coating and the spectral range for which it is designed. If known, you may also provide its index of refraction. For a beam splitter cube consisting of two prisms which are glued together, you may want to specify the the glue and the coatings of each prism.

field.name: coating_type
field.doc: Specify the coating type (e.g. dielectric, anti-reflection (AR), multilayer coating etc.).

field.name: coating_material
field.doc: Specify the coating material.

field.name: coating_thickness
field.doc: Thickness of the coating.

field.name: wavelength_range_coating
field.doc: Wavelength range for which the coating is designed. Enter the minimum and maximum values of the wavelength range.

field.name: index_of_refraction_coating
field.doc: Complex index of refraction of the coating. Specify at given spectral values (e.g. wavelength, energy, wavenumber etc.).

field.name: wavelength_range
field.doc: Wavelength range for which the beam splitter is designed. Enter the minimum and maximum values of the wavelength range. Alternatively, or additionally, you may define the wavelength range for the coating in coating/wavelength_range_coating.

field.name: optical_loss
field.doc: Optical loss of the beam splitter for the various outputs (i.e. the paths of the beam after being split by the beam splitter). The order of the ratios must be consistent with the labels 1, 2, ... N_outputs defined by the sketch in 'SHAPE/sketch', starting with 1.

field.name: incident_angle
field.doc: Optimized angle of incidence for the desired splitting ratio.

field.name: deflection_angle
field.doc: Angle of deflection corresponding to the optimized angle of incidence defined in incident_angle.

field.name: AOI_range
field.doc: Range of the angles of incidence (AOI) for which the beam splitter can be operated. Specify the minimum and maximum angles of the range.

field.name: reflectance
field.doc: Reflectance of the beam splitter at given spectral values.

field.name: transmission
field.doc: Transmission at given spectral values for the various outputs (i.e. the paths of the beam after being split by the beam splitter). The order of the ratios must be consistent with the labels 1, 2, ... N_outputs defined by the sketch in 'SHAPE/sketch', starting with 1.
